intro: Crucita hispanicoamericana, commonly known as the Spanish American crucifix flower, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its small, white or purple flowers that resemble a crucifix, hence its common name. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly serrated edge. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
